p: The study instrument included questions pertaining to demographics and sexual activity, in addition to several previously published, validated screening tools. To objectively quantify HIV risk, we used the HIV Incidence Risk Index for MSM (HIRI-MSM), a screening tool for HIV risk developed by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. The recommended cutoff score to identify men as high risk is â‰¥10, conferring a sensitivity of 84% and specificity of 45% for predicting incident HIV infection in the following six months.[ 18] Questionnaires were self-completed by participants in private, to minimize social desirability bias.
